PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. Fred Turner, 7616 Mulford Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 11, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe youngsters in their early teens, that is from 13 to 16 years of age, should be permitted to smoke cigarettes or drink alcoholic beverages?" answer reads: "No, I don't, because I didn't do it while I was growing up and this was good for me. My other reason is because I don't smoke cigarettes, even now."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Fred Turner wearing light colored beret, plaid shirt, light colored v-neck sweater, and dark leather jacket, standing on sidewalk on residential street with houses, telephone poles, and car
